Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue " Question: Startup time on Xamarin.Android" (#1802) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
A while ago I read about startup time on Xamarin.Android, link to the blog is http://tirania.org/blog/archive/2018/May-18.html (yap, it's Miguel de Icaza's blog), in the blog it says that to remove any dynamic code to integrate with Java Runtime, I don't know much about that but I found this https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/projects/1, is that project related to the blog I mentioned earlier?
Note that I already ask about startup time in X.F (https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/issues/2903).

Thanks..

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "System.IO.File.GetCreationTime and .GetLastWriteTime Returning 0" (#1798) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @OneVideo on May 31, 2018 2:56_

C# calls to System.IO.File.GetCreationTime and .GetLastWriteTime (for each of the local and UTC method forms) return 0 on Android target runtimes when the filename includes a period ('.') character in addition to the one delimiting the extension.  
   * Use of the character is permitted in Android filenames
   * Not using the character in the filename is a mitigation, as the functions return proper datetimes 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a file in LocalApplicationData directory.  Name it simply. e.g., Foobar.mp4
    In a Xamarin Forms project, code:     string sFn = "Foobar.mp4";
2. Use System.IO.File methods to observe the file creation datetime and modified, e.g.,
    string sFQFn = Path.Combine(System.Environment.GetFolderPath(System.Environment.SpecialFolder.LocalApplicationData), sFn);
    DateTime dtThisCopy = File.GetCreationTimeUtc(sFQFn );
    DateTime dtLastWrite = File.GetLastWriteTimeUtc(sFQFn );

3. Change the code so that sFn = "Foo.bar.mp4" and rename the referred to file, then repeat Step 2

### Expected Behavior
The DateTime values returned for "Foo.bar.mp4" and "Foobar.mp4" should be identical.
### Actual Behavior
Return values are DateTime equivalents of 0
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  XF 3.0.0.482510
- Last known good version:
- IDE:  Visual Studio 15.7
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: 25.4.0.2 APIs 
  - UWP:  <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Common.targets] Allow AdbTarget to be used for deployment" (#1797) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The current Install (_Deploy) target will fail with 'error : more than one device/emulator' if multiple devices or emulators are attached. This change allows us to pass the -s argument to adb (e.g. '/p:AdbTarget=-s foo'), which allows us to specify an individual target if multiple are present.

Failure example:

```
"Tests.csproj" (Install target) (1) ->
(_Deploy target) -> 
  EXEC : error : more than one device/emulator [/foo/bar/Tests.csproj]
  EXEC : error : more than one device/emulator [/foo/bar/Tests.csproj]
  adb : error : failed to get feature set: more than one device/emulator [/foo/bar/Tests.csproj]
  /foo/bar/xamarin.android-oss_v8.4.99.3_Darwin-x86_64_HEAD_7ba040a/bin/Release/lib/xamarin.android/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(3054,3): error MSB3073: The command ""/foo/bar/android-sdk-macosx/platform-tools/adb" install -r "bin/Release/Tests.Tests-Signed.apk"" exited with code 255. [/foo/bar/Tests.csproj]

    2 Warning(s)
    4 Error(s)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Intellisense can't recongize  'Resource.Dimension'  definition" (#1796) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @aixiaozi on May 28, 2018 9:49_

<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

I created some 'Resource.Dimension'  resource but Visual Studio 2017 intellisense can't recongize it. Underline all dimension resources in my cs code with the error: 

     `Resource.Dimension` does not contain a definition for...

Intellisense offer me only standard dimensions properties.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a blank Xamarin.Android project

2. Add dimens value in Resources\values\dimens.xml

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<resources>
    <dimen name="fab_margin">16dp</dimen>

  <dimen name="main_text_item_size">17dp</dimen>
</resources>

```

3. Use it in MainActivity:

```
var a = Resources.GetDimension(Resource.Dimension.fab_margin);
```
![a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18043540/40608828-63110f90-629f-11e8-9f7c-f0fa9cc1cc92.PNG)



### Expected Behavior
Without intellisense error


### Actual Behavior
Has intellisense error but could run application without a problem and problem persists.

### Basic Information
- IDE: VS 2017 15.7.2
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
- Android: Android Target Version: 27
- Android Support Library Version: the latest version: 27.0.2

Tried clean solution, delete bin&obj folder, problem exists. And I could found `Resource.Dimension` resource in `Resource.Designer.cs` file:

![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18043540/40608779-39b759c4-629f-11e8-9a74-ffc2102d6d22.PNG)




### Screenshots
![a](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18043540/40608548-5f3983b2-629e-11e8-805a-d5f0750470f1.PNG)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Large Object Stack leaking memory" (#1558) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Run the simple project 
2. Watch the android logcat and look for the garbage collections which show the large object used size
3. If the size is not increasing, increase the size of the "Size" variable in MainActivity.cs, the larger your device physical memory the larger the size required to cause the LOS to start growing with each allocation.

[TestMemory.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/1909654/TestMemory.zip)

### Expected Behavior
The LOS size should not increase when memory is allocated then released.

### Actual Behavior
The LOS can keep growing, reporting the amount of memory used in the LOS is larger than the actual physical memory of the device.

Here is a more detailed description of the issue.

We have been having issues of the large object stack increasing in size and not releasing memory eventually causing out of memory exceptions. The less memory the device has the more likely it is to happen.

The large object stack also can report that its size is larger than the real physical RAM size. 

In our real application it is very complex with thousands of memory objects of all sizes, the issue can happen with 5MB allocations when there are lots of other objects in the LOS.

However to make this repeatable I have narrowed it down to a very simple application. I created a new project and added just a hand full of lines of code to get this to repeat. Because the app is very simple the allocations needed to be much larger than in our app but the end result is the same.

```csharp
while (true)
{
    activityManager.GetMemoryInfo(tmp);
    Log.Info("GetProcessMemoryInfo", "Size:" + size 
        + " GetTotMem:" + GC.GetTotalMemory(false) / 1000000f 
        + " avail:" + tmp.AvailMem / 1000000f + " total:" + tmp.TotalMem / 1000000f);

    var bff = new byte[size * 1000000];

    Thread.Sleep(2000);
}
```

I just add a thread that every 2 seconds does an allocation of memory, that is then ready for the garbage collector to dispose of it. The 2 seconds can be extended to 30 seconds but the result is the same the speed of the allocation seems to have no effect.

I then check the memory statistics and print them to the android log.

I print out the GC.GetTotalMemory(false) result as well as the total memory and free memory returned from activityManager.GetMemoryInfo

Every device has an allocation size that this issue starts to happen. The more physical memory the larger the allocations need to be to start the LOS growing. With a device with 1GB of RAM the allocation size tends to be around 100MB to cause the climb. On a device with 2GB It was around 300MB. On a device with 4GB, it was around 700MB. Basically I just start with a low value and keep increasing until the LOS starts to grow every allocation call. So far every device I have tested has shown the problem.

Each call to allocated memory can increase the LOS size, even if I force a CG.Collect() the garbage before the allocation the LOS size keeps growing. However the free memory reported by   GetMemoryInfo does not reduce, so the free memory is not effected by this strange very large LOS. Just the LOS keeps thinking that it is growing. It can grow to be more than the physical memory size which is not possible.

After some time the app can Crash with out of memory exception however it never tried to kill any of the running applications like usually happens when the system is running out of memory, that is because OS thinks there is still plenty of free memory.

Yes the memory allocations are very high and not normal, however this is just to make it repeatable, very similar behavior was observed for smaller allocations in a complex application. So for a simple application the allocations needed to be much larger.

In this log each allocation at the beginning increases the GetTotMem variable, but the free memory does not change.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Unreliable build failures with non-obvious reason" (#1795) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Today I keep suffered from unreliable build failures and it turns out it's all build scripts fault.

```
"/sources/xamarin-android/Xamarin.Android.sln" (default target) (1) ->
"/sources/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.csproj" (default target) (33) ->
(_SetLatestTargetFrameworkVersion target) -> 
  /sources/xamarin-android/bin/Debug/lib/xamarin.android/xbuild/Xamarin/Android/Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(665,2): error MSB4018: The "ResolveSdks" task failed unexpectedly. [/sources/xamarin-android/src/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite/Xamarin.Android.NUnitLite.csproj]
```

This is all caused by unreliable Azure file hosting:

```
/sources/xamarin-android/build-tools/xa-prep-tasks/xa-prep-tasks.targets(75,5): warning : Unable to download URL `https://xamjenkinsartifact.azureedge.net/xamarin-android/xamarin-android/bin/Debug/bundle-v21-hce3edcfc-Debug-Linux-libzip=b95cf3f,llvm=bdb3a11,mono=6f9bef3.zip` to `/home/atsushi/android-archives/bundle-v21-hce3edcfc-Debug-Linux-libzip=b95cf3f,llvm=bdb3a11,mono=6f9bef3.zip`: 404 (Not Found) [/sources/xamarin-android/build-tools/xa-prep-tasks/xa-prep-tasks.csproj]
```

What to do here:

- Fix build scripts so that it immediately fails when downloads are not available.
  - Or make it somewhat optional by providing "continue on error" flag.
- Make downloads more trustable?

I also noticed that it should never try to download mono when its commit hash points to local changes. We need that when our changes involve changes to mono/mono and sending PRs in parallel.

Make them developer friendly.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Duplicate resource.designer.cs files used for intellisense and search results" (#1794) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open our Android project and notice how every Resource usage (e.g. Resource.Id.ambient_pager) has a squiggly line, and when hovered over says "Ambiguity between 'Resource.Id.ambient_pager' and 'Resource.Id.ambient_pager'.)
2. Execute a search in the project for "ambient_pager".
3. Notice how the search results contain two declarations of ambient_pager in two separate resource.designer.cs files, the correct one being in android-application/Resources and an incorrect one in android-application/obj/Debug-Dev/designtime.
4. Notice also how all of the resources in the designtime version are set to a value of 0.
5. Try deleting the offending designtime version and rebuild, and it will be regenerated so you can't get rid of it.

### Expected Behavior

It shouldn't include the designtime resource.designer.cs in the project for intellisense or search results purposes, as it's causing duplicate resources to be generated.

### Actual Behavior

It's generating a duplicate resource.designer.cs, very annoying.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[macOS] Navigating back from a complex page is highly inefficient" (#3001) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

Navigating back from a complex page is highly inefficient and takes from several seconds to several minutes. In debug I paused the process several times and checked the stack trace (sample attached below) and I guess that the problem is with the recursion in DisposeModelAndChildrenRenderers method (Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS/Platform.cs) that is called many times for the same child elements. 


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Navigate to a page with many nested elements (the tree should be very deep, f.e. 15 levels)
2. Navigate back
3. After navigation I have to wait because the application is frozen

### Expected Behavior

The page should be disposed quickly.

### Actual Behavior

Disposing the page takes from several seconds to several minutes.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.550146
- Last known good version:
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - macOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
- Affected Devices: macOS

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "horizontal Scrollview breaks scrolling when flowdirection is set to rtl" (#3000) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

As in the title the horizontal scrollview doesnt allow you to scroll anymore if you set its flowdirection to righttoleft

### Steps to Reproduce

1. make a scrollview with orientation set to horizontal
2. set its flowdirection to righttoleft

### Expected Behavior

scrolling working

### Actual Behavior


scrolling does not work

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.1.0.550168-pre3
- IDE: visual studio 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  not sure if it exists in ios
  - Android: oreo
  - UWP:  don't use it

### Related to

issue: #1222

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[UWP] ListView with null ItemsSource does not updates value if List is set to bound source" (#2981) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

UWP List dos not show entries if initial source is `null`

### Steps to Reproduce

Create a ListView with a Binding to a source. The source must initially be `null`. During the OnNavigatedTo method, set the Source to some list.

If the source is initialized to new `List<sometype>()` then everything works.

### Expected Behavior
ListView shows entries
### Actual Behavior
ListView does not show entries
### Basic Information

- Version with issue: > 3.0.0.530893
- Last known good version: 3.0.0.482510
- IDE: VS2017
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - UWP:  17134

I think this issue is somehow related with #2929

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[UWP] Fixes core debugging when debugging UWP." (#2997) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

When you start UWP debugger on a local machine, symbols are not copied to the folder with the application running in `AppX` folder. It does not allow to make breakpoints in Xamarin.Forms.Core.
To fix this problem after the build all the symbols are copied to the `AppX` folder.

### API Changes ###

/

### Behavioral Changes ###

Added post build script that copies all the *.pdb files to the `AppX` folder.

- [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)

- [ ] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[UWP] Xamarin.Forms 3.0 ListView ItemTapped event issue for UWP. " (#2996) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
I am facing LIST VIEW related issues after upgrading to Xamarin Forms 3.1.0.550168 package.
ItemTapped event is not working for Newly added item into list.

If item is already added into the list its working fine, but if you add item dynamically then Tapped event is not executing for new items. It's working fine for ANDROID.
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create Xamarin.Forms project.
2. Select Platform UWP.
3. Upgrade to Xamarin.Forms Nuget to 3.1.0.550168 
4. Add  ListView with 2-3 items and one button.
5. Bind ItemTapped event to listView using Xamarin.Forms.BehaviorsPack.
6. Run Project. 
7. ItemTapped will work fine for 2-3 items. Now click on Button and Added Item into the list on each click dynamically.
8. Item Tapped will not work for Newly added item.

### Expected Behavior
 Item Tapped Event should work for newly added items too.

### Actual Behavior
Item Tapped Event working for Exiting item only not working for dynamically added item.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: XF 3.1.0.550168 
- Last known good version: XF 2.5.1.527436
- IDE: Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - UWP:  16299 

- Affected Devices: UWP

### Screenshots
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30036418/41190633-6fcdfb84-6c00-11e8-837b-b79c25d1e90d.png)
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30036418/41190634-70172c00-6c00-11e8-91ea-42a360cb2f9b.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Debugger] Copy the NSUrlSessionHandler src. Fixes #3724" (#4193) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Ensure that we do copy and pathmap the code of the NSUrlSessionHandler. The old version was using the wrong pdb files that were missing some of the classes and therefore some of the needed src files.

The new used pdbs have all the data but use a different path for generated code. So:

* Code for the code generation path mangler updated.
* Tests updated.
* Updated the makefile.

Fixes https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/3724

### Steps to Reproduce

In a Mac App Cocoa App project:
1. Create a file
2. Edit the file
3. Your file's modified and created times should now be different
4. Use File.GetLastWriteTimeUtc and File.GetCreationTimeUtc on the file
5. Both DateTime objects will be the same, both are set to what File.GetLastWriteTimeUtc returned

### Expected Behavior
The creation time should be the same as it is on the system.
### Actual Behavior
The creation time is being set to the modified time.  I've confirmed that my creation time is correct in finder by right clicking and doing Get Info.
